utils

Class SoundSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • utils.SoundSystem

  • public class SoundSystem
extends java.lang.Object
    In order to remove some of the complexity of using MIDI in this coursework we have supplied you with a class that carries out the interactions with the MIDI system. MIDI is a set of standard commands that enables devices to communicate musical information to each other. If you are interested feel free to read more about MIDI (but it should not be necessary to use this class.

    To use this class you will need to initialise it correctly and pass an instance of the class to your musicians. To setup the SoundSystem, you will need to:

    • Create a new instance of the SoundSystem using: soundSystem = new SoundSystem();
    • You can reinitialise the SoundSystem (and this will stop the current music playing using soundSystem.init()
    • You can get the SoundSystem work in silent mode by calling soundSytem.setSilentMote(true)
    • You can also enable the text mode (which the SoundSystem will write the notes to the standard output
    • You can use setIntrument(int, int) method to tell the SoundSystem which instrument it is and which seat it is sitting.
    • Finally, you can call playNote(int, int, int) to play a note for a particular instrument

    • Field Detail

      • MAX_INSTRUMENTS

        public static int MAX_INSTRUMENTS
        The maximum number of instruments.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SoundSystem

        public SoundSystem()
            throws javax.sound.midi.MidiUnavailableException
        Create a new synthesizer and open it ready for playing. Add in the instruments from the default soundbank.
        Throws:
        javax.sound.midi.MidiUnavailableException - if the synthesizer is not available due to resource restrictions, or no synthesizer is installed in the system

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init()
        Method to (re-)initialise the sound system.
        • The silent mode is False
        • The text mode is False
        • Stop the current playing, if any
        • Reset information about last notes played

      • setInstrument

        public void setInstrument(int instrumentPosition,
                          int instrument)
        Method to set the instrument to the Sound System.
        Parameters:
        instrumentPosition - The position of the instrument in the Sound System. This must be between 0 and 15.
        instrument - The ID of the input instrument. See Wikipedia for instrument IDs.

      • playNote

        public void playNote(int instrumentPosition,
                     int note,
                     int loudness)
        Play the input note using the instrument at the given instrumentPosition. If silent mode is enabled then no sounds will be heard. If text mode is enabled then messages will be printed to the console.
        Parameters:
        instrumentPosition - The position of the instrument in the Sound System. This must be between 0 and 15.
        note - The note to be played on the sound system. This is a MIDI note number (between 0 and 127).
        loudness - The loudness level of the note to be played.

      • setSilentMode

        public void setSilentMode(boolean silentMode)
        Mutator method for setting the silent mode.
        Parameters:
        silentMode - true to enable the silent mode and false to disable the silent mode.

      • setTextMode

        public void setTextMode(boolean textMode)
        Mutator method for setting the text mode.
        Parameters:
        textMode - true to enable the text mode and false to disable the text mode.
